questions.question: What is the space group of the lanthanide-based metal-organic framework [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O]?
What are the two temperatures at which dielectric anomalies were observed in the study of [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O]?
Which semiempirical quantum approach was found to be the most accurate in predicting the unit cell structure and coordination polyhedron geometry of [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O]?
True or False: The ferroelectric phase transition observed in [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O] is of first order.
What causes the spontaneous polarization in the low temperature phase of [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O]?
questions.answer: The ordering of protons of hydroxyl groups

questions.question: True or False: The Sparkle/PM7 model predicted the heat of formation for [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O] to be approximately -2524 kJ/mol.
What is the role of tartrate ligands in the structure of [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O]?
questions.answer: They act as bridges between Nd atoms, forming a 2D chiral structure.

questions.question: True or False: The dielectric constant (e0) of [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O] shows frequency independence at temperatures below 185 K.
What is the significance of the second dielectric anomaly at 185 K in the study of [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O]?
questions.answer: It is attributed to the freezing down of the motion of the hydroxyl groups.

questions.question: True or False: The Sparkle/PM7 model was unable to accurately predict the geometries of the coordination polyhedron in [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O].
How does the structure of [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O] contribute to its ferroelectric properties?
questions.answer: The structure's disorder and the ordering of protons of hydroxyl groups at lower temperatures contribute to its ferroelectric properties.

questions.question: True or False: The conductivity of [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O] is attributed to the hopping of electrons between different localized states.
What is the role of hydrogen bonding in the structure of [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O]?
questions.answer: Hydrogen bonding links the 2D chiral sheets into a 3D porous framework.

questions.question: True or False: The Sparkle/PM7 model predicted the ionization energy for [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O] to be approximately 10.463 eV.
What experimental technique was used to determine the unit cell parameters of [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O]?
questions.answer: X-ray diffraction on a Bruker Kappa Appex II X-ray diffractometer

questions.question: True or False: The Sparkle/PM7 model is the least accurate among the three semiempirical quantum approaches tested for [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O].
What is the significance of the Curie-Weiss law in the context of the [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O] study?
questions.answer: It indicates the second-order nature of the ferroelectric phase transition at TC2.

questions.question: True or False: The Sparkle/PM7 model's prediction of the unit cell volume for [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O] was significantly higher than the experimental value.
What is the average O-H…O hydrogen bonding distance in the structure of [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O]?
True or False: The dielectric anomalies observed in [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O] are attributed to the phase transitions in the material.
